qa_pairs.question: What positions did Julius Kakeeto hold before becoming CEO of PostBank Uganda, and how did his experience at those roles contribute to his appointment?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Julius Kakeeto held the position of Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer (MD & CEO) of Orient Bank, a Ugandan commercial bank, from 2015 until 2019, prior to becoming CEO of PostBank Uganda.<cite>[S3]</cite></statement><statement>Before leading Orient Bank, he served as Finance Director at Equity Bank (Uganda) and worked at Ernst & Young and Citibank, where he held roles such as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Vice President in the Investment Banking Division, focusing on Emerging Markets.<cite>[S13][S14][S16][S17]</cite></statement><statement>Kakeeto's experience at Orient Bank, where he transformed it from the highest loss-making bank in Uganda to a top-tier institution, likely contributed to his appointment at PostBank Uganda, as it demonstrated his ability to lead turnaround efforts and improve financial performance.<cite>[S19]</cite></statement><statement>His roles at Citibank, including strategic planning and investment banking, provided him with expertise in financial management and emerging markets, which would have been critical for leading PostBank Uganda's restructuring and securing a Class 1 licence from the Central Bank.<cite>[S15][S16][S20]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] Julius Kakeeto


# Julius Kakeeto



**Julius Kakeeto** is a Ugandan accountant, businessman, and bank executive. [S2] He has been the managing director and chief executive officer of PostBank Uganda since November 2019. [S3] Before that, from 2015 until 2019, he was the managing director and CEO of Orient Bank, a Ugandan commercial bank. [S4] ## Background and education

Julius Kakeeto was born at St. [S5] Francis Hospital Nsambya in Kampala, Uganda to Engineer Hillary Kakeeto a civil servant and Maria Goretti Kakeeto. [S6] He attended St. [S7] Mary's College Kisubi before entering Strathmore University, in Nairobi, Kenya, where he obtained his ACCA. [S8] He holds a Master of Business Administration, from Manchester Business School, in the United Kingdom. [S9] He is a Fellow of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (FCCA) of the United Kingdom. [S10] He is also a member of the Institute of Certified Public Accountants of Uganda (ICPAU). [S11] He is a graduate of Harvard Business School, AMP Class 206. [S12] ## Career

Kakeeto worked with Ernst & Young from 1998 to 2000. [S13] He joined Citibank Uganda in 2000 rising to the role of Chief Financial Officer in the new subsidiary. [S14] Following that, he worked at the headquarters of Citibank's Africa Division in Johannesburg, South Africa. [S15] He then transferred to Citibank's offices in London initially in the Strategy and Planning team before transferring to the Investment Banking Division where he worked as a Vice President focusing on Emerging Markets. [S16] Before joining Orient Bank, he was the Finance Director at Equity Bank (Uganda). [S17] In 2015, he was appointed the Chief Executive Officer at Orient Bank, having headed the institution in an acting capacity since 2014. [S18] Since then, he has improved Orient Bank from being the highest loss making bank in Uganda to the top half of the industry. [S19] In 2019, Kakeeto was hired by PostBank Uganda, as the new managing director and chief executive officer, replacing Steven Mukweli who was battling corruption charges. [S20] Since his appointment, he has led a restructuring process to reorganise the operations of the bank, resulting in the Central Bank granting PostBank with a Class 1 licence that allows it to operate as a fully fledged Tier 1 commercial bank.

Julius Kakeeto was born at St. [S5] Francis Hospital Nsambya in Kampala, Uganda to Engineer Hillary Kakeeto a civil servant and Maria Goretti Kakeeto. [S9] He is a Fellow of the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (FCCA) of the United Kingdom. [S10] He is also a member of the Institute of Certified Public Accountants of Uganda (ICPAU). [S11] He is a graduate of Harvard Business School, AMP Class 206. [S12] ## Career

qa_pairs.question: What were the key achievements of Julius Kakeeto during his tenure at Orient Bank, and how did these achievements impact his subsequent role at PostBank Uganda?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Julius Kakeeto's key achievement at Orient Bank was transforming it from the highest loss-making bank in Uganda to the top half of the industry during his tenure as CEO from 2015 to 2019.<cite>[S19]</cite></statement> <statement>His success at Orient Bank led to his appointment as managing director and CEO of PostBank Uganda in 2019, where he initiated a restructuring process that resulted in PostBank obtaining a Class 1 licence, enabling it to operate as a fully fledged Tier 1 commercial bank.<cite>[S20]</cite></statement>
